Package com.example.mainapplication.ui.home.food

Class FoodAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<FoodAdapter.ViewHolder>
      • com.example.mainapplication.ui.home.food.FoodAdapter
  • public class FoodAdapter
extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<FoodAdapter.ViewHolder>
    FOOD ADAPTER The Food Adapter class acts as an intermediary class between the Recycler View and the restaurant list received from the Middle Man It is used to create the cards that are used by the Recycler View from the foods listed in each restaurant
    Author:
    Ryan Ledbetter

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  FoodAdapter.ViewHolder
      The class ViewHolder is used to hold the views of the recycler view.

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private android.content.Context context
      This is the context
      private Restaurant currRestaurant
      This is the current restaurant from which we will get the food that are available
      private java.util.List<Food> foodList
      This is the list of foods
      (package private) MiddleMan middleMan
      middleMan is the middleman used to communicate with the server and cache.

      • FoodAdapter

        public FoodAdapter​(Restaurant currRestaurant,
                   android.content.Context context)
        Constructs a Food Adapter which creates a new instance of the Food Adapter when called
        Parameters:
        currRestaurant - current restaurant from which the list of available foods will come from
        context - context of the activity containing the food list

      • FoodAdapter

        public FoodAdapter​(java.util.List<Food> foodList,
                   android.content.Context context)
        The constructor of the FoodAdapter creates a new instance of the FoodAdapter this one is used for the center tab as it does not require a restaurant
        Parameters:
        foodList - the list of all foods available
        context - context of the activity containing the food list
